intro: Astroloma discolor, commonly known as the variable astroloma, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, often hairy, yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Astroloma discolor is often found in coastal and inland regions, thriving in full sun.
